stk.calculators.ga.selectors module¶

Defines Selector classes.

Selectors are objects with a select() method, which is used to select molecules from a Population. Examples of how Selector classes can be used is given their documentation, for example Fittest, Roulette or AboveAverage.

Selector can be combined to generate more complex selection processes, such as stochastic sampling, using SelectorSequence or SelectorFunnel. Examples of how this can happen are given in the documentation of these two classes.

Available selectors.¶

  1. Fittest
  2. Roulette
  3. AboveAverage
  4. SelectorSequence
  5. SelectorFunnel

Extending stk: Making new selectors.¶

When a new Selector class is made it must inherit Selector and define a select() method. select() must take a single argument, which is the Population from which molecules are selected.

class stk.calculators.ga.selectors.AboveAverage(duplicate_batches=False, num=None, duplicates=True, use_rank=False, batch_size=1)¶

Bases: stk.calculators.ga.selectors.Selector

Yields above average batches of molecules.

The fitness of a batch is the sum of all fitness values of the molecules in the batch. Contrary to the name, this selector will also yield a batch which has exactly average fitness.

duplicate_batches¶

If True, the same batch may be yielded more than once. For example, if the batch has a fitness twice above average it will be yielded twice, if it has a fitness three times above average, it will be yielded three times and so on.

Type:bool

Examples

Yielding molecules one at a time. For example, if molecules need to be selected for mutation or the next generation.

# Make a population holding some molecules.
pop = Population(...)

# Make the selector.
above_avg = AboveAverage()

# Select the molecules.
for selected, in above_avg.select(pop):
    # Do stuff with each selected molecule, like apply a
    # mutation to it to generate a mutant.
    mutant = mutator.mutate(selected)

Yielding multiple molecules at once. For example, if molecules need to be selected for crossover.

# Make a population holding some molecules.
pop = Population(...)

# Make the selector.
above_avg = AboveAverage(batch_size=2)

# Select the molecules.
for selected in above_avg.select(pop):
    # selected is a tuple of length 2, holding the selected
    # molecules. You can do stuff with the selected molecules
    # Like apply crossover operations on them.
    offspring = list(crosser.crossover(*selectd))
__init__(duplicate_batches=False, num=None, duplicates=True, use_rank=False, batch_size=1)¶

Initializes a AboveAverage instance.

Parameters:
  • duplicate_batches (bool, optional) – If True, the same batch may be yielded more than once. For example, if the batch has a fitness twice above average it will be yielded twice, if it has a fitness three times above average, it will be yielded three times and so on.
  • num (int, optional) – The number of batches to yield. If None then yielding will continue forever or until the generator is exhausted, whichever comes first.
  • duplicates (bool, optional) – If True, the same molecule can be yielded in more than one batch.
  • use_rank (bool, optional) – When True the fitness value of an individual is calculated as f = 1/rank.
  • batch_size (int, optional) – The number of molecules yielded at once.
_batch(population)¶

Batch molecules of population together.

Parameters:population (Population) – A Population from which batches of molecules are selected.
Yields:tuple – A tuple of form (batch, fitness) where batch is a tuple of Molecule and fitness is a float which is the sum of all fitness values of the molecules in the batch.
_no_duplicates(batches)¶

Makes sure that no molecule is yielded in more than one batch.

Parameters:batches (iterable) – An iterable yielding tuple of form (batch, fitness) where batch is a tuple of Molecule.
Yields:tuple – A tuple of form (batch, fitness) where batch is a tuple of Molecule and fitness is a float.
select(population)¶

Yields above average fitness batches of molecules.

Parameters:population (Populaion) – The population from which individuals are to be selected.
Yields:tuple of Molecule – The next selected batch of molecules.
class stk.calculators.ga.selectors.Fittest(num=None, duplicates=True, batch_size=1)¶

Bases: stk.calculators.ga.selectors.Selector

Selects batches of molcules, fittest first.

The fitness of a batch is the sum of the fitness values of the molecules in the batch.

Examples

Yielding molecules one at a time. For example, if molecules need to be selected for mutation or the next generation.

# Make a population holding some molecules.
pop = Population(...)

# Make the selector.
fittest = Fittest()

# Select the molecules.
for selected, in fittest.select(pop):
    # Do stuff with each selected molecule, like apply a
    # mutation to it to generate a mutant.
    mutant = mutator.mutate(selected)

Yielding multiple molecules at once. For example, if molecules need to be selected for crossover.

# Make a population holding some molecules.
pop = Population(...)

# Make the selector.
fittest = Fittest(batch_size=2)

# Select the molecules.
for selected in fittest.select(pop):
    # selected is a tuple of length 2, holding the selected
    # molecules. You can do stuff with the selected molecules
    # Like apply crossover operations on them.
    offspring = list(crosser.crossover(*selectd))

  • duplicates (bool, optional) – If True, the same molecule can be yielded in more than one batch.
  • batch_size (int, optional) – The number of molecules yielded at once.

class stk.calculators.ga.selectors.Roulette(num=None, duplicates=True, use_rank=False, batch_size=1)¶

Bases: stk.calculators.ga.selectors.Selector

Uses roulette selection to select batches of molecules.

In roulette selection the probability a batch is selected is given by its fitness. If the total fitness is the sum of all fitness values, the chance a batch is selected is given by:

p = batch fitness / total fitness,

where p is the probability of selection and the batch fitness is the sum of all fitness values of molecules in the batch [1].

References

[1]http://tinyurl.com/csc3djm

Examples

Yielding molecules one at a time. For example, if molecules need to be selected for mutation or the next generation.

# Make a population holding some molecules.
pop = Population(...)

# Make the selector.
roulette = Roulette()

# Select the molecules.
for selected, in roulette.select(pop):
    # Do stuff with each selected molecule, like apply a
    # mutation to it to generate a mutant.
    mutant = mutator.mutate(selected)

Yielding multiple molecules at once. For example, if molecules need to be selected for crossover.

# Make a population holding some molecules.
pop = Population(...)

# Make the selector.
roulette = Roulette(batch_size=2)

# Select the molecules.
for selected in roulette.select(pop):
    # selected is a tuple of length 2, holding the selected
    # molecules. You can do stuff with the selected molecules
    # Like apply crossover operations on them.
    offspring = list(crosser.crossover(*selectd))
__init__(num=None, duplicates=True, use_rank=False, batch_size=1)¶

Initializes a Roulette instance.

Parameters:
  • num (int, optional) – The number of batches to yield. If None then yielding will continue forever or until the generator is exhausted, whichever comes first.
  • duplicates (bool, optional) – If True the same member can be yielded in more than one batch.
  • use_rank (bool, optional) – When True the fitness value of an individual is calculated as f = 1/rank.
  • batch_size (int, optional) – The number of molecules yielded at once.
_batch(population)¶

Batch molecules of population together.

Parameters:population (Population) – A Population from which batches of molecules are selected.
Yields:tuple – A tuple of form (batch, fitness) where batch is a tuple of Molecule and fitness is a float which is the sum of all fitness values of the molecules in the batch.

Makes sure that no molecule is yielded in more than one batch.

Parameters:batches (iterable) – An iterable yielding tuple of form (batch, fitness) where batch is a tuple of Molecule.
Yields:tuple – A tuple of form (batch, fitness) where batch is a tuple of Molecule and fitness is a float.
select(population)¶

Yields batches of molecules using roulette selection.

Parameters:population (Populaion) – A Population from which batches of molecules are selected.
Yields:tuple of Molecule – A batch of selected molecules.
class stk.calculators.ga.selectors.Selector(num, duplicates, use_rank, batch_size)¶

Bases: object

Selects batches of molecules from a population.

Molecules are selected in batches, and each batch is selected based on its fitness. The fitness of a batch is the sum of all fitness values of the molecules in the batch. Batches may be of size 1, if single molecules are to be yielded.

num¶

The number of batches to yield. If None then yielding will continue forever or until the generator is exhausted, whichever comes first.

Type:int
duplicates¶

If True the same member can be yielded in more than one batch.

Type:bool
use_rank¶

When True the fitness value of a molecule is calculated as f = 1/rank.

Type:bool
batch_size¶

The number of molecules yielded at once.

Type:int
yielded¶

The previously yielded molecules.

Type:set of Molecule
reset_yielded¶

If True yielded is emptied before each select().

Type:bool
__init__(num, duplicates, use_rank, batch_size)¶

Initializes a Selector instance.

Parameters:
  • num (int) – The number of batches to yield. If None then yielding will continue forever or until the generator is exhausted, whichever comes first.
  • duplicates (bool) – If True the same member can be yielded in more than one batch.
  • use_rank (bool) – When True the fitness value of a moleucle is calculated as f = 1/rank.
  • batch_size (int) – The number of molecules yielded at once.
_batch(population)¶

Batch molecules of population together.

Parameters:population (Population) – A Population from which batches of molecules are selected.
Yields:tuple – A tuple of form (batch, fitness) where batch is a tuple of Molecule and fitness is a float which is the sum of all fitness values of the molecules in the batch.
_no_duplicates(batches)¶

Makes sure that no molecule is yielded in more than one batch.

Parameters:batches (iterable) – An iterable yielding tuple of form (batch, fitness) where batch is a tuple of Molecule.
Yields:tuple – A tuple of form (batch, fitness) where batch is a tuple of Molecule and fitness is a float.
select(population)¶

Selects batches of molecules from population.

Parameters:population (Population) – A Population from which batches of molecules are selected.
Yields:tuple of Molecule – A batch of selected molecules.
class stk.calculators.ga.selectors.SelectorFunnel(*selectors)¶

Bases: stk.calculators.ga.selectors.Selector

Applies Selector objects in order.

Each Selector in selectors is used until exhaustion. The molecules selected by each Selector are passed to the next one for selection. As a result, only the final Selector can yield batches of size greater than 1.

selectors¶

The Selector objects used to select molecules. For all except the last num must be 1.

Type:tuple of Selector

Examples

Use Roulette on only the 10 molecules with the highest fitness.

# Make a population with 20 molecules.
pop = Population(...)

# Create a Selector which yields the top 10 molecules according
# to roulette selection.
fittest = Fittest(num=10)
roulette = Roulette()
elitist_roulette = SelectorFunnel(fittest, roulette)

# Use the selector to yield molecules.
for selected_mol in elitist_roulette.select(pop):
    # Do something with the selected molecules.
    ...
__init__(*selectors)¶

Initializes a SelectorFunnel instance.

Parameters:*selectors (Selector) – The Selector objects used to select molecules. For all except the last num must be 1.
_batch(population)¶

Batch molecules of population together.

Parameters:population (Population) – A Population from which batches of molecules are selected.
Yields:tuple – A tuple of form (batch, fitness) where batch is a tuple of Molecule and fitness is a float which is the sum of all fitness values of the molecules in the batch.
_no_duplicates(batches)¶

Makes sure that no molecule is yielded in more than one batch.

Parameters:batches (iterable) – An iterable yielding tuple of form (batch, fitness) where batch is a tuple of Molecule.
Yields:tuple – A tuple of form (batch, fitness) where batch is a tuple of Molecule and fitness is a float.

Yields batches of molecules.

Parameters:population (Population) – A Population from which batches of molecules are selected.
Yields:tuple of Molecule – A batch of selected molecules.
class stk.calculators.ga.selectors.SelectorSequence(*selectors)¶

Bases: stk.calculators.ga.selectors.Selector

Yields from selectors in order.

selectors¶

The Selector objects used to select molecules.

Type:tuple of Selector

Examples

First use Fittest to select the 10 fittest batches and then use Roulette to select batches in proportion to their fitness.

# Make a population.
pop = Population(...)

# Create a Selector which yields 10 batches of molecules and
# then uses roulette selection indefinitely.
fittest = Fittest(batch_size=3)
roulette = Roulette(batch_size=3)
elitist_roulette = SelectorSequence(fittest, roulette)

# Use the selector to yield molecules.
for selected_mol in elitist_roulette.select(pop):
    # Do something with the selected molecules.
    ...
__init__(*selectors)¶

Initializes a SelectorSequence instance.

Parameters:*selectors (Selector) – The Selector objects used to select molecules.
_batch(population)¶

Batch molecules of population together.

Parameters:population (Population) – A Population from which batches of molecules are selected.
Yields:tuple – A tuple of form (batch, fitness) where batch is a tuple of Molecule and fitness is a float which is the sum of all fitness values of the molecules in the batch.
_no_duplicates(batches)¶

Makes sure that no molecule is yielded in more than one batch.

Parameters:batches (iterable) – An iterable yielding tuple of form (batch, fitness) where batch is a tuple of Molecule.
Yields:tuple – A tuple of form (batch, fitness) where batch is a tuple of Molecule and fitness is a float.

Yields batches of molecules.

Makes every select() call empty yielded.
